definition: to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Hu
to make up (a story)/Taiwan pr. [zou1]
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
to talk nonsense (idiom); saying whatever comes into his head
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
to talk nonsense (idiom); saying whatever comes into his head
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head

sentences.english: He spun a yarn about his friendship with the royal family.
sentences.chinese: 他胡謅了一通所謂他與王室之間友情的故事。

sentences.english: He spun a yarn about his adventures in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 他胡謅了一個他在非洲的冒險故事。

sentences.english: It was a jumble without taste or truth.
sentences.chinese: 那是一種缺乏鑑賞力和真實性的胡謅。

sentences.english: This must just be his weird take on it.
sentences.chinese: 這肯定只是他的胡謅而已。

sentences.english: Now tell me the truth: I don't want any more of your fairy stories. '
sentences.chinese: 把真相告訴我，我不想再聽你胡謅了。

sentences.english: Anybody who says we can balance the budget without raising taxes is just talking through his hat.
sentences.chinese: 任何說不通過提稅就可以平衡預算的人都是在胡謅。

sentences.english: The speaker is drivelling about the sagging economy.
sentences.chinese: 演講人正在胡謅蕭條中的經濟。

sentences.english: I could never pull something like that off.
Who but a fool like he would talk through his hat.
sentences.chinese: 除了他這樣蠢人誰會如此胡謅。

definition: to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
sequel/continuation of a book
to play deaf-mute
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to exaggerate
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
